intro: Siebera haplosciadia, commonly known as the slender sieve-geranium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Siebera haplosciadia is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grasslands and rocky areas. It is often found in open habitats and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
